intro: Agrostophyllum korubunense, commonly known as the Korubun sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand saline and arid conditions. Agrostophyllum korubunense plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and providing habitat for native fauna.
